title: the Irish Aviation Authority Act 1993 (No. 29 of 1993), hereby orders as
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Irish Aviation Authority (Unmanned
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Irish Aviation Authority (Unmanned 

Aircraft Systems (Drones)) (Amendment) (No .2) Order 2023. 

Amendment of the Principal Order

title: the Irish Aviation Authority Act 1993 (No. 29 of 1993), hereby orders as
heading: 2. The Principal Order is amended in regulation 2, by inserting the
text_raw:
2. The Principal Order is amended in regulation 2, by inserting the 

following definitions: 

“Counter-UAS System” means a system for the detection, classification, 
monitoring or neutralisation of unauthorised UAS. 

“Aerodrome operator certified 
the EASA 
Regulations” means the operator of an aerodrome holding a certificate 
issued in accordance with Article 36 of Regulation (EU) 2018/1139. 

in accordance with
text_norm: 2 principal order amended regulation 2 inserting following definition counter-uas system mean system detection classification monitoring neutralisation unauthorised uas aerodrome operator certified easa regulation mean operator aerodrome holding certificate issued accordance article 36 regulation (eu) 2018 1139 accordance

title: the Irish Aviation Authority Act 1993 (No. 29 of 1993), hereby orders as
heading: 3. The Principal Order is amended by inserting after Article 21 the
text_raw:
3. The Principal Order is amended by inserting after Article 21 the 

following: 

21A. (1) An aerodrome operator certified in accordance with the EASA 
Regulations may deploy a Counter-UAS System (C-UAS) for use within 
the aerodrome, subject to the approval of the Authority. 

(2) 
If it appears to an aerodrome operator certified in accordance with 
the EASA Regulations that a UAS is being operated in such a manner as 
to cause a risk to the safety of civil aviation or give rise to a requirement 
to protect people or property, the aerodrome operator shall be entitled to 
take such steps as appear necessary to ensure the safety of civil aviation 
and/or public safety, as appropriate. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 10th March, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [103] 3 

Present when the common seal of the Irish Aviation Authority 

was affixed hereto 
 7 March 2023 

ROSE HYNES, 
Director 

DECLAN FITZPATRICK, 

Director 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [103]

title: the Irish Aviation Authority Act 1993 (No. 29 of 1993), hereby orders as
heading: (This note is not part of the Order and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Order and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

This Order sets out the necessary national measures to provide for the 
authorisation, deployment and use of Counter-UAS System (C-UAS) within a 
certified aerodrome.
